data.title: Southern alert sounds over more expected rain misery
data.description: The Operation Centre for Flood and Landslide Victims has warned authorities and residents to prepare for new downpours in the southern region, already battered by widespread  flooding .

data.title: UN envoy urges soil, water action
data.description: The United Nations Special Envoy on Water has said constructive action to ensure sustainable soil and water management should be a high political priority for all member states.

data.title: Crew's release awaits Myanmar nod
data.description: The government will have to wait for Nay Pyi Taw to decide on the fate of the Thai crewmembers detained in the neighbouring country following an incident off the coast of Ranong last week, as local authorities are not authorised to sign off on their release.

data.title: Committee 'ready' to meet on Thursday to discuss minimum wage hike
data.description: All eyes are on the upcoming meeting of a new tripartite wage committee, which is expected to decide on the government

data.title: Illegal workers in Korea urged to sign up for amnesty
data.description: Thai workers who are staying illegally in South Korea have been urged to report to immigration authorities to take advantage of a voluntary return programme, which would exempt them from fines and other penalties.

data.title: Anutin says no to coup bill
data.description: The  Bhumjaithai Party  has opposed a bill proposed by the ruling  Pheu Thai Party  to amend the Defence Ministry Administration Act, which is seen as a bid to curb the military

data.title: SAM Engineering Marks Significant Milestone with Aerospace and Semiconductor Expansion in Thailand
data.description: SAM Engineering & Equipment (M) Berhad (SAMEE) has celebrated a pivotal moment in its strategic expansion, officially opening two factories and breaking ground on a third facility in Ban Bueng, Chonburi, highlighting its growing capabilities in aerospace and semiconductor equipment manufacturing.

data.title: Thai local mats featured in Dior Gold House
data.description: Blending traditional craftsmanship with modern luxury, Chanthaburi’s renowned handwoven mats have been reimagined in stylish designs showcased at Dior Gold House, a new high-end destination in Bangkok.

data.title: Five men found dead in fermented fish tank in Petchabun
data.description: PHETCHABUN: Five men were found  dead  in a fish fermentation tank at a  fermented fish plant  in Lom Sak district of this northern Thai province on Monday evening.

data.title: Five men found dead in fermented fish pond
data.description: PHETCHABUN: Five men were found dead in a fish fermentation pond at a fermented fish plant in Lom Sak district of this northern province on Monday evening.

data.title: ONE Championship’s Thongpoon out to avenge El Jamari loss after ‘unlocking’ old self at Fight Night 26
data.description: Thongpoon PK Saenchai has called for a rematch with Zakaria El Jamari after getting back in the ONE Championship win column on Saturday in Bangkok.

data.title: Art highlights at Jim Thompson Farm
data.description: The milder weather brings with it every year many floral festivals and events where you can get in touch with nature. But if you want to get in touch with nature and appreciate art in one go, Art On Farm at the Jim Thompson Farm Tour, which runs until Jan 1, should be the one stone that kills two birds.

data.title: Trang airport terminal contractor sacked
data.description: The Airport Department has terminated the construction contract for Trang Airport’s new passenger terminal after the contractor abandoned the project for more than six months, director Danai Ruangsorn said on Monday.

data.title: Court delays Khao Kradong hearing pending amendments to complaint
data.description: The court has postponed the hearing against nine Interior Ministry officials to January 28, giving the plaintiff time to amend charges

data.title: Thai govt vows stronger fight against corruption
data.description: The government has vowed to be proactive in addressing corruption in a bid to raise the country’s Corruption Perceptions Index (CPI) score from 35 to over 50 out of 100.

data.title: Activist beefs up petition targeting Pheu Thai over handouts
data.description: Activist Sonthiya Sawasdee has provided additional documents to support his  petition  filed with the  Constitutional Court  against the  Pheu Thai  Party for allegedly failing to honour its  election-policy  10,000-baht digital wallet scheme.

data.title: Concerns grow over nationwide wage hike amid economic uncertainty
data.description: Thai agencies issue caution over nationwide 400 baht wage increase, citing concerns about economic impacts and risk to recovery

data.title: Five issues for Paetongtarn government
data.description: Government set to present its progress after three months in office on December 12

data.title: KTC to redefine consumer finance through digital transformation
data.description: Among the upgrades planned for 2025 are customisation of offerings, addressing fraud and developing a secure e-service platform

data.title: Green Fund Propels Saraburi’s Low-Carbon Cement Model
data.description: The Thai Cement Manufacturers Association (TCMA), in collaboration with the Thai and Canadian governments, UNIDO, and the Global Cement and Concrete Association (GCCA), has launched the ‘SARABURI SANDBOX,’ a groundbreaking low-carbon pilot project to advance sustainability in the cement and concrete industry. Supported by a green fund from Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC), this initiative is Thailand’s first regional prototype for reducing carbon emissions in its largest cement production hub.

data.title: TOAVH Restructures with Primus Group to Drive Growth
data.description: TOA Venture Holding Co ., Ltd. (TOAVH) has announced a major organisational restructuring, appointing Primus Group to oversee its auto dealership business, which represents seven major brands. This move aims to enhance operational efficiency and competitiveness.

data.title: Train services back to normal in southern Thailand Thursday
data.description: All southern trains will resume normal operations on Thursday after fatal flooding in the region damaged the tracks, forcing them to terminate at Hat Yai station.

data.title: Thais, Malaysians caught as Malaysia begins enforcing border laws
data.description: Malaysian police have made their first  arrests  since Malaysia began enforcing bans on its citizens  illegally crossing the border  into  Thailand  from  Kelantan  state.
